response.raw:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>

# Enforcing Administration Policies and Rules Governing Students

1. Familiarize yourself with policies
   - Review school handbook and district guidelines
   - Attend staff meetings for policy updates
   - Consult with administration for clarification

2. Communicate rules clearly to students
   - Discuss expectations at the beginning of the year
   - Post classroom rules visibly
   - Remind students of policies regularly

3. Implement consistent consequences
   - Follow prescribed disciplinary procedures
   - Apply rules fairly to all students
   - Document infractions and actions taken

4. Model appropriate behavior
   - Adhere to policies yourself
   - Demonstrate respect for rules and authority

5. Collaborate with colleagues
   - Ensure uniform enforcement across classrooms
   - Share effective strategies for policy compliance

6. Involve parents/guardians
   - Inform them of school policies
   - Communicate any rule violations promptly
   - Partner in reinforcing rules at home

7. Address violations promptly
   - Intervene immediately when rules are broken
   - Use teachable moments to reinforce expectations

8. Recognize and reward compliance
   - Acknowledge students who consistently follow rules
   - Implement positive behavior reinforcement systems

9. Adapt enforcement to student needs
   - Consider individual circumstances when appropriate
   - Consult with special education team if necessary

10. Regularly review and reflect
    - Assess effectiveness of enforcement strategies
    - Provide feedback to administration on policy implementation

</OUTPUT_TEXT>

<OUTPUT_TEXT>
# Enforcing Administration Policies and Rules Governing Students

1. Familiarize yourself with policies
   - Review school handbook and district guidelines
   - Attend staff meetings for policy updates
   - Consult with administration for clarification

2. Communicate rules clearly to students
   - Discuss expectations at the beginning of the year
   - Post classroom rules visibly
   - Remind students of policies regularly

3. Implement consistent consequences
   - Follow prescribed disciplinary procedures
   - Apply rules fairly to all students
   - Document infractions and actions taken

4. Model appropriate behavior
   - Adhere to policies yourself
   - Demonstrate respect for rules and authority

5. Collaborate with colleagues
   - Ensure uniform enforcement across classrooms
   - Share effective strategies for policy compliance

6. Involve parents/guardians
   - Inform them of school policies
   - Communicate any rule violations promptly
   - Partner in reinforcing rules at home

7. Address violations promptly
   - Intervene immediately when rules are broken
   - Use teachable moments to reinforce expectations

8. Recognize and reward compliance
   - Acknowledge students who consistently follow rules
   - Implement positive behavior reinforcement systems

9. Adapt enforcement to student needs
   - Consider individual circumstances when appropriate
   - Consult with special education team if necessary

10. Regularly review and reflect
    - Assess effectiveness of enforcement strategies
    - Provide feedback to administration on policy implementation
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
